definition: to pursue closely/to press/to demand (payment)/to extort (a concession)
to chase after/to seek/to do one's utmost to seek or procure sth/to recall
to sculpt/to carve/musical instrument (old)
to force (sb to do sth)/to compel/to press for/to extort/to press on towards/to press up to/to close in on/euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]

sentences.english: You turn on me ruthlessly ; with the might of your hand you attack me.
sentences.chinese: 你向我變心，待我殘忍，又用大能追逼我。

sentences.english: Mine enemies chased me sore, like a bird, without cause.
sentences.chinese: 無故與我爲仇的追逼我，像追雀鳥一樣。

sentences.english: He was hounded to the cliff.
sentences.chinese: 他被追逼到了懸崖邊上。

sentences.english: I thought long and hard about pursuing him, but in the end I decided to let him go.
sentences.chinese: 我總想要追逼他，最後，我決定讓他走吧。

sentences.english: Police then chased the robbers to a house in Jeppestown close to the city centre.
sentences.chinese: 警察把劫匪追逼到靠近市中心傑皮斯鎮的一所房子裏。

sentences.english: All her pursuers have overtaken her In the midst of distress.
sentences.chinese: 在急難中，一切追逼她的人將她追上了。
